1.text: Job also added, taking up his parable, and said:

2.text: As God liveth, who hath taken away my judgment, and the Almighty, who hath brought my soul to bitterness,

3.text: As long as breath remaineth in me, and the spirit of God in my nostrils,

4.text: My lips shall not speak iniquity, neither shall my tongue contrive lying.

5.text: God forbid that I should judge you to be just: till I die I will not depart from my innocence.

6.text: My justification, which I have begun to hold, I will not forsake: for my heart doth not reprehend me in all my life.

7.text: Let my enemy be as the ungodly, and my adversary as the wicked one.

8.text: For what is the hope of the hypocrite if through covetousness he take by violence, and God deliver not his soul?

9.text: Will God hear his cry, when distress shall come upon him?

10.text: Or can he delight himself in the Almighty, and call upon God at all times?

11.text: I will teach you by the hand of God, what the Almighty hath, and I will not conceal it.

12.text: Behold you all know it, and why do you speak vain things without cause?

13.text: This is the portion of a wicked man with God, and the inheritance of the violent, which they shall receive of the Almighty.

14.text: If his sons be multiplied, they shall be for the sword, and his grandsons shall not be filled with bread.

15.text: They that shall remain of him, shall be buried in death, and his widows shall not weep.

16.text: If he shall heap together silver as earth, and prepare raiment as clay,

17.text: He shall prepare indeed, but the just man shall be clothed with it: and the innocent shall divide the silver.

18.text: He hath built his house as a moth, and as a keeper he hath made a booth.

19.text: The rich man when he shall sleep shall take away nothing with him: he shall open his eyes and find nothing.

20.text: Poverty like water shall take hold on him, a tempest shall oppress him in the night.

21.text: A burning wind shall take him up, and carry him away, and as a whirlwind shall snatch him from his place.

22.text: And he shall cast upon him, and shall not spare: out of his hand he would willingly flee.

23.text: He shall clasp his hands upon him, and shall hiss at him, beholding his place.
